Comments_List: I learned a lot about concisely presenting research. I had some good feedback and encouragement on my first year project. There were a lot of really fascinating presentations from other lab members that got me interested in topics I hadn't thought I was interested in - for example, number cognition.

It was great to have a small-group environment in which to be introduced to other people's projects. 

Conversations tend to move very quickly back and forth, which can be either a strength and a weakness depending on the topic. On days when it appears there's no other urgent business, I think it would be discuss a paper we've all read ahead of time.
